content: Once you have their money, you never give it back.
The best deal is the one that makes the most profit.
Never spend more for an acquisition than you have to.
A woman wearing clothes is like a man in the kitchen.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Always exaggerate your estimates.
Never let family stand in the way of opportunity.
Always keep your ears open.
source: In the Hands of the Prophets (DS9 episode)

content: Small print leads to large risk.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Instinct, plus opportunity, equals profit.
Greed is eternal.
Even if its free, you can always buy it cheaper.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Anything worth selling is worth selling twice.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Anything worth doing is worth doing for money.
Dead men close no deals.
source: Demons of Air and Darkness (DS9 novel)

content: A deal is a deal (is a deal)...until a better one comes along.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: A contract is a contract is a contract... but only between Ferengi.
A Ferengi without profit is no Ferengi at all.
Satisfaction is not guaranteed.
He who dives under the table today lives to profit tomorrow.
source: Ferenginar: Satisfaction is Not Guaranteed (DS9 novella)

content: Never place friendship before profit.
Wise men can hear profit in the wind.
Nothing is more important than your health...except for your money.
You can't make a deal if you're dead.
There's nothing more dangerous than an honest businessman.
What's in it for me?
A wise man knows that confidentiality equals profit.
Never make fun of a Ferengi's mother.
Insult something he cares about.
It never hurts to suck up to the boss.
War is good for business.
Peace is good for business.
The early investor reaps the most interest.
She can touch your lobes but never your latinum.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Profit is its own reward.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Feed your greed, but not enough to choke it.
Never confuse wisdom with luck.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Expand or die.*
Never trust a man wearing a better suit than your own.
The bigger the smile, the sharper the knife.
Never ask when you can take.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Never trust anybody taller than you.
Rate divided by time equals profit. (Also known as The Velocity of Wealth.)
Take joy from profit, and profit from joy.
source: Worlds of Deep Space Nine: Bajor: Fragments and Omens (DS9 novel)

content: Good customers are almost as rare as latinum...treasure them.
There is no substitute for success.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Free advice is seldom cheap.
Keep your lies consistent.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: The riskier the road, the greater the profit.
Work is the best therapy-at least for your employees.
Win or lose, there's always Hupyrian beetle snuff.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Ferengi are not responsible for the stupidity of other races.
Knowledge equals profit.
Home is where the heart is, but the stars are made of latinum.
Every once in a while, declare peace. It confuses the Hell out of your enemies.
If you break it, you bought it.
Beware of the Vulcan greed for knowledge.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: The flimsier the product, the higher the price.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Never let the competition know what you're thinking.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Learn the customer's weaknesses, so that you can better take advantage of him.
It ain't over 'til its over.
source: Ferenginar: Satisfaction is Not Guaranteed (DS9 novella)

content: Ask not what you can do for your profits, but what your profits can do for you.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: There are many paths to profit.
Females and finances don't mix.
Expand or die.*
Enough...is never enough.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Every man has his price.
Trust is the biggest liability of all.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Nature decays, but latinum lasts forever.
Sleep can interfere with...
Faith moves mountains...of inventory.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: There is no honor in poverty.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Dignity and an empty sack is worth the sack.
Exploitation begins at home.
Treat people in your debt like family... exploit them.
Never have sex with the boss' sister.
Always have sex with the boss.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Everything is for sale - even friendship.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Even a blind man can recognize the glow of Latinum.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: You can't make a deal if you're dead.
Wives serve; brother inherit.
Only fools pay retail.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: There's nothing wrong with charity... as long as it winds up in your pocket.
People love the bartender.
Sell the sizzle, not the steak.
Even in the worst of times, someone turns a profit.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Whisper your way to success.
source: Treachery, Faith, and the Great River (DS9 episode)

content: Know your enemies... but do business with them always.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Not even dishonesty can tarnish the shine of profit.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: When life hands you ungaberries, make detergent.
A Ferengi waits to bid until his opponents have exhausted themselves.
Not even dishonesty can tarnish the shine of profit.
Let others keep their reputation. You keep their money.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Hear all, trust nothing.
Never cheat a Klingon... unless you're sure you can get away with it.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 novel)

content: Trouble comes in threes.
It's always good business to know about new customers before they walk in your door.
Location, location, location.
A Ferengi chooses no side but his own
source: (DS9 novel: Ferenginar: Satisfaction is Not Guaranteed)

content: The justification for profit is profit.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: New customers are like razor-toothed gree worms. They can be succulent, but sometimes they bite back.
Sometimes, the only thing more dangerous than a question is an answer.
Employees are the rungs on the ladder of success, don't hesitate to step on them.
A good lie is easier to believe than the truth.
Never begin a business transaction on an empty stomach.
source: DS9 episode: The Maquis, Part I

content: Never gamble with a telepath.
You can't free a fish from water.
source: DS9 episode: Past Tense, Part I

content: Always know what you're buying.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: Sometimes what you get free cost entirely too much.
Possession is eleven-tenths of the law!
Beware the man who doesn't take time for Oo-mox.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: If that's what's written, then that's what's written.
Latinum lasts longer than lust.
Duck; death is tall.
You can't buy fate.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: Never be afraid to mislabel a product.
Time, like latinum, is a highly limited commodity.
More is good...all is better.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: A wife is [a] luxury... a smart accountant a neccessity.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: When the messenger comes to appropriate your profits, kill the messenger.
A wealthy man can afford everything except a conscience.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: Never let doubt interfere with your lust for Latinum.
When in doubt, lie.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: Always inspect the merchandise before making a deal.
If it ain't broke, don't fix it.
source: DS9 novel: Ferenginar: Satisfaction is Not Guaranteed)

content: Deep down, everyone's a Ferengi.
source: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition (DS9 reference book)

content: No good deed ever goes unpunished.
